title: 112_s1439
content: The Act may be cited as the "Ready Schools Act of 2011" and pertains to ready schools. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include a description of how local educational agencies will assist elementary schools in conducting a school needs review every 3 years to support students in meeting state and grade level expectations. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include support for successful transitions for children and the needs of schools regarding appropriate curricula, materials, teaching practices, assessments, and accommodations. The Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is amended to include support for successful transitions for children, appropriate services and supports for children with disabilities and limited English proficiency, family and community engagement policies, school climate that supports positive development, and leadership and support for school staff. The curr_chunk discusses the involvement of school leaders, teachers, and support personnel in the development and learning of young children, as well as the assignment of teachers based on qualifications and appropriate student-to-teacher ratios for prekindergarten through grade 3. The curr_chunk focuses on teacher and student interactions in the classroom that enhance instruction and learning, as well as outreach and collaboration with early childhood education providers in the school attendance area. The curr_chunk addresses issues related to high-quality standards, curricula, classroom practices, instructional assessment, and transitions between program settings. The curr_chunk discusses other providers of services that support learning and development, such as nutrition, health, and mental health services.
